TopicTitle: Stock Turbojets can't push me to 2k m/s

Articles.Content:
So let me preface this post by saying that I'm pretty familiar with the game (IMO). I've been playing for a decent amount of time (about 500 hours) and I've made SSTO spaceplanes before, also SR71-type jets that skim the upper atmosphere, but for some reason I can't figure this out. 

I feel that i WAS pretty familiar with high-altitude flight but it seems that since the .90 update my stock turbojet engines have a crazy power loss at 1000m/s, which doesn't make sense. According to the .cfg file's velocityCurve data the engine should be pushing full power output at 1000m/s, trailing off to 50% at 2000m/s, but that's not appearing to be the case here. Once the jet hits 1000m/s the engine loses so much power that the jet just sits at 1060m/s and will not go any faster, regardless if I'm at 18km altitude or 25km. It's happened on every craft so far. No mods installed, except kerbal engineer redux for more vessel info. I've does various tests to try to narrow down what's causing it. TWR ranging from .9 all the way to 2.5, as well as making sure there's plenty of intake air to be used (never a flameout). I've even tried modifying the velocityCurve to improve performance (100% at 2000m/s) and still no dice. The ONLY time the planes will go over 1100m/s at ANY altitude is if i set "useVelocityCurve = false", and when it's set to false, I have no problem getting to orbit with the exact same jets.

Here's the default velocityCurve data for the Turbojet Engine:

    velocityCurve    {        key = 0 0.5 0 0        key = 1000 1 0 0        key = 2000 0.5 0 0        key = 2400 0 0 0    }

And here's how i've tried modifying it with zero success:

    velocityCurve    {        key = 0 0.5 0 0        key = 1000 1 0 0        key = 2000 1 0 0        key = 2400 0 0 0    }

From googling it I've pretty much gathered that in the key, the first number is your speed in m/s, the second number is a percentage of max thrust (0.5 being 50%). SO, since it's a FloatCurve, there SHOULD be an engine power loss for the default engine after 1000m/s, but it should start small and scale down to 50% at 2000, but it doesn't, it's cutting to less than 50% immediately (feels exactly like a governor in a vehicle). Especially the case with the modified version, there should be NO power loss. I'm scratching my head with this and it's becoming an obsession to figure this out. Hopefully someone smarter than me will have an answer for this and hopefully a fix...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-20T18:27:49Z" title="02/20/2015 06:27  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 20, 2015</time> by brothertim**
  
Answered

Do you use FAR? I have no trouble with stock souposphere and highaltitude 2000m/s speed on stock turbojets. As far as I know, FAR modifies the jet engines, might be it. You wouldn't see the changes on the stock part config files because its done via modulemanager. (wild guess and dangerous half-knowledge here, so someone correct me if I am wrong).

Actually, I do have B9 installed. Sorry, I didn't even think to mention it. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

And after a little digging, that's exactly what's causing it. I found a quote on the B9 mod page. 

> 
> Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Q: Why aren't stock jets giving me 2500m/s top speed like they used to?
> Because stock jet engine configs are completely unrealistic, so they were reworked to match real-life turbojet performance. No, turbojets don't ever go to Mach 7. No, you can't call it a ram jet, they don't go that fast either (and don't go that slow either). No, you can't call it a Scimitar precooled engine, even that futuristic concept never gets above mach 5.5. Stock jet stats are completely insane, remove challenge from spaceplane design and kill any reason to use realistically balanced engines added by B9. New configs solve that while still leaving them perfectly viable for your spaceplanes, - just on equal rights with any other engine in this mod.

So I guess B9 requires FAR as well as new spaceplane designs for hypersonic speeds. Oh well, back to the drawing board. Thank you, WhiteKnuckle, for mentioning B9 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I hate not understanding why things aren't working properly.

> 
> Actually, I do have B9 installed. Sorry, I didn't even think to mention it. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
> And after a little digging, that's exactly what's causing it. I found a quote on the B9 mod page. 
> 
> 
> 
> So I guess B9 requires FAR as well as new spaceplane designs for hypersonic speeds. Oh well, back to the drawing board. Thank you, WhiteKnuckle, for mentioning B9 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I hate not understanding why things aren't working properly.

Ha, I only asked because I ran into the exact same problem a few weeks back. I had no idea that B9 nerfed the stock jet engines and was pulling my hair out trying to figure out why.
